texts.name: Hamlet
texts.text: To be, or not to be, that is the question.

texts.name: Hamlet
texts.text: Whether 'tis nobler in the mind to suffer the slings and arrows of outrageous fortune, or to take arms against a sea of troubles, and by opposing end them?

texts.name: Hamlet
texts.text: To die—to sleep, no more, and by as sleep to say we end the heart-ache and the thousand natural shocks that flesh is heir to.

texts.name: Hamlet
texts.text: 'Tis a consummation devoutly to be wish'd. To die, to sleep. To sleep, perchance to dream!

texts.name: Hamlet
texts.text: Ay, there's the rub. For in that sleep of death what dreams may come when we have shuffled off this mortal coil, must give us pause...
Today is Hamlet's premiere.
The theater's atmosphere couldn't be more different from the premiere of A Midsummer Night's dream.
All the seats are filled.
Both the second and third floor as well.
I hear that our plays have become something of a hot topic among the aristocracy.
However...
The theater, as full as it is, is as quiet as can be.
Every person there is on the edge of their seat, their attention focused on Olivia's performance as Hamlet.
They're silent, but enraptured.
Silent, but receptive.
A mysterious air hangs over her debut.

texts.name: Hamlet
texts.text: Thou livest; report me and my cause alright. In this harsh world draw thy breath in pain, to tell my story. Of carnal, bloody, and unnatural acts, of deaths put on by cunning and forced cause.

texts.name: Hamlet
texts.text: I cannot live to hear the news from England. On you, he has my dying voice.

texts.name: Hamlet
texts.text: The rest, is silence...
Hamlet's quest for revenge culminates in him losing the woman he loved, his mother, and his own life as he succumbs to poison most vile.
If I didn't get this story out of my system, perhaps that would be me right now.
I can see myself in there.
My very own ghost, overlapping with the Hamlet on the stage.
Perhaps everyone in this theater has felt like this at one point in their lives.
Hamlet dies in the arms of his trusted friend, Horatio, and the curtain falls.
There is a moment of silence...
Before a rapturous cheer like none I've ever heard reaches us in the wings.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: I am glad to see my cute little playwright wasn't a flash in the pan.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: Of course. Need I remind you I sold scripts before A Midsummer Night's Dream?

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: But the play that made your name famous was that very one. The credit goes to my troupe.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: And I see you're getting used to greeting the public at the end of the plays. Getting used to our popularity, are we?

texts.name: Will
texts.text: Well, it seems to make the audience happy.
I ascend to the empty stage in response to the persistent cheers.
I've gotten used to this too.
And I'm no longer so excited I'm trembling, the way I was on that first day.
There's something a little sad about that, but I like the feeling that I'm gaining confidence as a writer.

texts.name: Kiki
texts.text: Will?
I hear Kiki's voice from behind the curtain and turn back.

texts.name: Kiki
texts.text: You have a visitor.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: Huh? Who? If it's a critic, tell them to go away. They're free to spread whatever bollocks they want.

texts.name: Kiki
texts.text: But they said they know you?

texts.name: Will
texts.text: Me?

texts.name: Marlowe
texts.text: Salutations, William Shakespeare.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: Ah, it's you.
Marlowe is waiting for me as I exit the wings and step out into the auditorium.
Oh, right. I'm supposed to be having a contest with him.
At first, I'd channeled my regret over Ed's death into a desire to enact revenge against this man.
But now, all of my time and effort is going towards protecting Olivia.
To be honest, I really have no time to entertain this pompous toad.

texts.name: Marlowe
texts.text: It looks like you're doing well. Word has reached even my ears.

texts.name: Marlowe
texts.text: I never knew this troupe had such a remarkable actor. He commands the stage well. Is he the leader?

texts.name: Will
texts.text: ...Thanks for the praise, I suppose.
I realize he's talking about Olivia.
I suppose, as a fellow creator, he would see through the diversion of Kiki.

texts.name: Marlowe
texts.text: And I see your wounds have healed as well.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: You came to bring up that old stuff? I'm acting, and I'm quite well, thank you.
As I say that, I'm actually surprised it's been less than a month since the last time I saw Marlowe.
Since then, my life has consisted of rehearsing Hamlet while performing A Midsummer Night's Dream, with nights spent writing my new play.
So much has happened that the person I was back then feels like a stranger now.
Still, my grief over Ed's death has not faded.
I still feel the pain, but I no longer feel inclined to channel it into a rivalry with this man.

texts.name: Marlowe
texts.text: You've gained an audience, indeed, but it doesn't seem like the critics are quite so enthusiastic about your works. Why do you suppose that is?

texts.name: Will
texts.text: I couldn't care less.

texts.name: Marlowe
texts.text: Well, let me tell you. Your pretty words might deceive the common rabble, but they can't fool experts with a discerning eye.

texts.name: Marlowe
texts.text: Don't go presuming you're closer to a court performance for the achievement of filling up this paltry theater.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: You came here to tell me that? You must not have much to do.

texts.name: Marlowe
texts.text: I—

texts.name: Will
texts.text: Look, I'm past all this with you now.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: I don't care if critics want to trash our work to make themselves look smart.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: I don't care if you want to find fault with me either. Why not go ahead and write a play about it, eh?

texts.name: Marlowe
texts.text: Do not misjudge me, Shakespeare. I would never use my work in such a petty manner.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: Well, if you have such high standards about your plays...

texts.name: Will
texts.text: Why not write them yourself, Marlowe?

texts.name: Marlowe
texts.text: You accuse me falsely, sir.
I let out a sigh.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: Sorry, I need go write my new play. I've no time for more of these mock duels with you.

texts.name: Marlowe
texts.text: You run from me, William Shakespeare? But remember your oath. Whoever is not selected for the court performance will give up writing.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: Yeah, I remember. Let's call it off.
Marlowe's eyes widen.

texts.name: Marlowe
texts.text: Hahah... Ahahahah! Lost your nerve, have you, William Shakespeare?

texts.name: Will
texts.text: No, I intend to keep my promise. If I lose, I give up writing.
If my writing is weak enough to lose to this swine, then I have no hope of protecting Olivia.
If that happens, I'll need to think of some other way.
It's more important for me to protect her than to keep writing works for my own ego.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: But if you lose, I won't require you to give up your quill.

texts.name: Marlowe
texts.text: What?

texts.name: Will
texts.text: Your words have lost all relevance anyway. You came here because, on some level, you know that.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: Besides, in a way, you've already given up the quill. Cry false accusations all you want, but you can't hide from the truth.

texts.name: Marlowe
texts.text: You've become quite adept at running your mouth.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: So feel free to write again if it ever strikes your fancy. It doesn't matter to me either way.

texts.name: Marlowe
texts.text: This is an affront, William Shakespeare.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: You don't have to say my full name every time.
Marlowe's really glaring at me now.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: Are we done here? I'm busy writing my new play, and time is too precious to waste. Don't make me say it again.

texts.name: Marlowe
texts.text: Things won't go your way here, William Shakespeare.
Marlowe leaves, his eyes burning with hatred.
It's not as if my hatred for him has simply vanished into the ether.
But at one point, I wanted to gain enough fame to drown out his name and erase him from history.
And now...
Something else fills my heart. A drive to keep this troupe alive and well.
Besides, given that little display he put on just now, I'd say that my mission as it pertains him is complete.
So, I'll set all thoughts of him aside...
And direct all my attention to the new script.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: If he marries Juliet, Tybalt will be his cousin, right?

texts.name: Will
texts.text: So he resolves not to fight like he usually would.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: But obviously, Romeo is the only one that has had a change of heart.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: The younger members of the Montague and Capulet families escalate the conflict.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: Right.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: This is the second tragedy that befalls Romeo.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: Second? What was the first?

texts.name: Will
texts.text: Why, the feud between the Montagues and the Capulets itself.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: Ah, I see.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: And then, Tybalt Capulet pierces the heart of Romeo's best friend with his blade.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: His friend is killed, right in front of his eyes.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: And he...
Romeo loses his friend because of a meaningless feud between the two houses.
I can imagine the scene as if I were there.
As I explain the events of the scene, and Romeo's mindset...
All the memories, the sorrow of the day I watched Ed die, come rushing back to me.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: Will.
Olivia rests her hand on mine.
Only then do I realize that my hands are shaking.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: It's okay. It's not your story. This is happening to Romeo Montague.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: Yeah.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: Think you can write it?
I nod.
She smiles and lets go of my hand.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: The moment he sees his friend struck down in front of him, he is overtaken by a deep hatred.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: All feelings of love desert him, even Juliet's memory leaves his mind...

texts.name: Will
texts.text: And he stabs Tybalt dead.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: That's the second tragedy.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: You should take a break. I know you're tired.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: Mmh, yeah. I think I will.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: That man came by today, didn't he?

texts.name: Will
texts.text: Who?

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: Marlowe.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: Ah, yeah.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: I don't know what he really wanted, though.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: To study the enemy, of course. Not even the Admiral's Men can afford to ignore us anymore.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: It's extremely out of character for Marlowe to come to a rival theater himself. Unprecedented, really.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: I think the disdain you showed him was unprecedented, too.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: Oh, you were listening?

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: We could hear you two in the wings. We lost our bloody minds.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: If I wasn't so tired, I might have sparred a little longer.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: Getting confident, are we?

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: This is a duel between us and the Admiral's Men.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: Mm...

texts.name: Will
texts.text: We'll win. There is no theatergoer in town that would rather watch someone else's plays over ours.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: But you have to give up writing if we're not selected for the court performance, right? And you're not holding Marlowe to the same?

texts.name: Will
texts.text: What point would there be in writing plays for a country where even the queen is blind?

texts.name: Will
texts.text: If it comes to that, I'll just look for another way to protect you.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: That's my boy.
Olivia gently brings her hands to my cheeks and plants a kiss on my lips.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: Of course, we're getting that court performance.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: I know. We'll become the Lord Chamberlain's men and change the law.
Olivia smiles at me blissfully.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: And it's more than that. The court is a beautiful stage. A stage worthy of our talents.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: I will perform your play about true love atop the most beautiful, brightest stage in the whole world.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: What greater joy could there be?

texts.name: Will
texts.text: You...

texts.name: Will
texts.text: You really were born for the stage.
She smiles and brings her lips close to mine.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: Of course I was. Did you only just realize?

texts.name: Will
texts.text: Actually...

texts.name: Will
texts.text: I've known since the day we met.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: Good boy.
Again, she presses her lips to mine.
Then she slowly breaks the kiss.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: But don't let your guard down.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: What?

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: You told Marlowe you were writing a new play, didn't you? He may attempt to steal the script, or perhaps interfere with the performance itself.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: Our scripts are the most important things to our troupe, almost as precious as our lives.
I can't help but chuckle.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: What's so funny?

texts.name: Will
texts.text: A month ago, you'd have told me the scripts were more precious than our lives.
Olivia glares at me.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: Stop talking nonsense and start writing already.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: All right, ma'am.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: So, Romeo kills Tybalt, and...
I'm seated at my desk.
In his fury, Romeo sends his blade through the chest of Tybalt, a member of the Capulets.
Romeo is driven from Verona. Juliet, in her grief, searches for a way to be with him.
But...

texts.name: Will
texts.text: It's no good.
When I mutter to myself, Olivia takes her eyes off the first half of the draft to look at me.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: What's wrong?

texts.name: Will
texts.text: I can't write.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: There's no way they can end up together.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: If I write the story to its natural conclusion, they both end up dead.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: That's how the original draft went, right? It's fine.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: But...
I look up at her.
Our eyes meet.
My muse, the basis for Juliet, is right in front of me.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: I am not Juliet, and you are not Romeo.
Romeo is banished from the city after killing Tybalt.
Still, Juliet's love for him endures, and she drinks a potion that will let her appear dead, long enough to free her to be with him.
She sends her beloved Romeo a letter explaining her plan, but...

texts.name: Will
texts.text: I still can't kill them.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: Calm down. You're getting too invested.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: Why not save it for tomorrow?

texts.name: Will
texts.text: Yeah, sorry.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: I know I need to finish this.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: I know that, but...
Hamlet's premiere was today.
Truth is, we should have begun rehearsing for Romeo and Juliet today too.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: I'll finish it tomorrow.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: All right, let's just take more time to rehearse Hamlet tomorrow. You can skip work at the pub too.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: But I—

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: Your time should be spent writing, not washing cups. This is your leader's order.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: All right.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: Let's go to bed for tonight, okay?

texts.name: Will
texts.text: Okay.
Olivia regards the audience with a beaming smile when the play is over.
But that smile is gone the moment she steps backstage.
She closes one eye and her face twists in pain as grips her left wrist.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: Olivia?

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: I'm fine, it's just a little cut. Bring me a dressing.
When she lets go of her arm, I see blood seeping into her costume.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: Hey now!

texts.name: Kiki
texts.text: Oh, whoa!
Kiki quickly prepares a dressing and wraps it around her arm.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: It's okay, just a shallow cut. It's not like we put real poison on the blades.
Olivia laughs lightly.
The last scene of Hamlet features a swordfight.
Hamlet's arm is sliced by the tip of a poisoned saber, which leads to his death.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: But...

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: Injuries come with the territory. Don't get spooked by a little cut.
Olivia looks up at me.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: Didn't I say the responsibility is mine?

texts.name: Will
texts.text: R-Right.

texts.name: Kiki
texts.text: We need to change you out of that costume. It's all bloody. Thomas, can we get another one like this?

texts.name: Thomas
texts.text: You need but ask.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: A clean one this time. I don't want to stink.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: Well, say something!

texts.name: Thomas
texts.text: As clean as possible, understood.

texts.name: Kiki
texts.text: Hey, Will. Do you remember that man from the Admiral's Men who came by yesterday?

texts.name: Will
texts.text: Hm?

texts.name: Thomas
texts.text: Marlowe, right? He's here again.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: Again?

texts.name: Kiki
texts.text: He brought more people today.

texts.name: Thomas
texts.text: And they don't seem to want to leave.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: Huh?

texts.name: Kiki
texts.text: Maybe they're waiting for the theater to empty out. I don't think they're trying to ambush us, though.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: Really, don't they have anything better to do?

texts.name: Kiki
texts.text: I did hear the Lily Theater has had a lot of empty seats these days.
Thomas nods at Kiki's words.

texts.name: Thomas
texts.text: The lads that help me make the tickets mentioned that.

texts.name: Kiki
texts.text: But what else would you expect? The best plays in town are right here.
Kiki and Thomas giggle together.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: I see. So he brought along some actors from the Admiral's Men today, huh?

texts.name: Kiki
texts.text: Possibly.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: We should be cautious, just in case.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: Let's take the strongbox with us today. Our earnings have been increasing a lot.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: Losing money would be bad, but losing a script would be much worse.

texts.name: Kiki
texts.text: Mhm, indeed.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: Are you going to be making tickets today, Thomas?

texts.name: Thomas
texts.text: We wouldn't have enough if I didn't. Even though we make a lot every day!

texts.name: Kiki
texts.text: What about the new play? We started practicing for Hamlet before the second showing of A Midsummer Night's dream, so I assumed we'd see it today.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: I've hit a little block. It's not done quite yet.

texts.name: Kiki
texts.text: Oh, sorry to hear it.
After making sure that all the audience have left the theater, Olivia and I head to the pub.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: You feel up for writing today?

texts.name: Will
texts.text: Mm? Yeah.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: I have to, yes.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: The audience was cheering again today. I feel like the plays are really touching them.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: We can polish up the first draft together, so just focus on getting it done.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: Just let it pour out, like you're humming to yourself.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: Yeah, I'll get it done.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: Say...

texts.name: Will
texts.text: Mm?

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: Is that the strongbox from the theater you're carrying?

texts.name: Will
texts.text: Yeah.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: Apparently, the Admiral's Men came around today with Marlowe. I don't know what they're up to, so I thought this would be prudent.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: He came again?

texts.name: Will
texts.text: It seems they're having trouble filling seats in their theater.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: The Lily?
I nod.
Olivia's expression becomes a mix of astonishment and glee.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: They're losing customers? That's unprecedented. If it's true, then this is history in the making.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: Yeah, Thomas heard about it from his friends.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: So rumors are already spreading.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: Huh?

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: There's nothing nobles love quite like rumors. It's possible this one has already reached Queen Elizabeth's ears.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: If they hear about us as a troupe capable of stealing an audience from the Admiral's Men, the court performance is as good as ours.
Olivia rattles on excitedly, but behind her...

texts.name: Will
texts.text: It's not just a rumor, Olivia. It's very clear that the Lily Theater's actors have nothing better to do with their time.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: Huh?
Olivia looks behind her, following my gaze.
There stands Marlowe, surrounded by his cronies.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: I don't quite see what you hope to accomplish by harassing me, Marlowe.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: Picking fights with me won't get you any closer to the court performance. If you have time to hang around our theater, I suggest—
The usually talkative Marlowe remains silent, his gaze fixed on a particular spot.
Olivia's left hand.
As always, Olivia takes care not to speak in front of him.

texts.name: Marlowe
texts.text: Are you wounded, fair damsel?
Marlowe is staring at the dressing peeking out from under her cuff.

texts.name: Marlowe
texts.text: Are you all right? Were you cut?

texts.name: Marlowe
texts.text: By a saber coated in poison, perhaps?
Olivia smiles at him.
An abstruse smile that neither affirms nor denies.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: Sadly, she got that cut at the pub.

texts.name: Marlowe
texts.text: Is that so?

texts.name: Will
texts.text: Wanna come for a drink? I'll hear out your woes about your lost audience. I could even give you some advice.

texts.name: Marlowe
texts.text: I believe I'll have to pass on your kind offer. I'd rather not take my custom to a pub where Catholics gather.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: Excuse me?

texts.name: Marlowe
texts.text: And I have urgent business that needs attending to. Your offer is tempting, but I'll have to decline.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: Hah, okay.
I take Olivia's hand and lead her away from Marlowe.

texts.name: Marlowe
texts.text: Shakespeare.
Marlowe leaves with a confident grin.

texts.name: Marlowe
texts.text: ...See you tomorrow.
Marlowe leaves, a disgusting grin plastered across his face.
In the end, I work my shift in the pub together with Olivia.
Olivia's wound is close to her hand, so I want to handle the washing myself.
When the customers leave and my dad goes upstairs, we sit for a while in silence together.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: Tomorrow...

texts.name: Will
texts.text: Mm?

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: Let's explain the situation to everyone. We can't let them go on stage without telling them and risk having them walk into a trap.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: Okay. But we don't know that we've truly been found out just yet.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: And even if we have, he may just want to try and extort us.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: If all he wants is money, then that's easy enough to deal with. We just need to get more people into the theater.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: True...

texts.name: Will
texts.text: Are you gonna perform tomorrow?
Olivia looks into my eyes.
I return her gaze with my own.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: I want to.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: We can't stop here. If we do...
She turns her eyes down.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: I won't know what my life has been for anymore.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: So long as I'm still able, I want to stand on the stage.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: Olivia.
She raises her head.
I see the pain and uncertainty in her eyes.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: This is your troupe. Did we ever have a rule that said women can't perform?

texts.name: Will
texts.text: If you want to do it, go ahead. It's your choice.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: As to whether or not the other members will join you on the stage...

texts.name: Will
texts.text: They will have to decide that for themselves.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: Perform if you want to. I'm writing these plays so that you can shine up there.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: ...All right.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: Thank you.
The whole troupe is gathered for practice as usual.
Not one person is late.
I'm just realizing how organized the troupe has gotten in just a month.

texts.name: Kiki
texts.text: So today's the third day since we premiered Hamlet, huh?

texts.name: Thomas
texts.text: It's about time for a comedy, I'd say.
Our troupe is the only thing the theater world is talking about too.
Olivia and I exchange glances.
Seeing that she's a little nervous, I give her a reassuring nod.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: Everyone.

texts.name: Kiki
texts.text: Oh?

texts.name: Thomas
texts.text: What, are you going to get all lovey dovey in front of us again?

texts.name: Kiki
texts.text: You think they'll tell us about their first time or something?

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: It's possible that Marlowe discovered our secret yesterday.

texts.name: Kiki
texts.text: Secret?
Kiki tilts his head in puzzlement.

texts.name: Thomas
texts.text: And that would be?

texts.name: Will
texts.text: I know what you mean. We're so used to it, it's easy to forget.
Kiki and Thomas look at each other.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: He saw the wound I got while playing Hamlet yesterday.
Kiki and Thomas look down at her hand.

texts.name: Kiki
texts.text: He saw the dressing on your hand?
Olivia nods.

texts.name: Kiki
texts.text: Is it my fault?

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: No, it's not. I was just careless. I should have noticed when I changed.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: And what's more, I was the one in charge of the rehearsals. If I'd spent more time on the swordplay, this wouldn't have happened.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: I was also the one who imposed that strict deadline. If anyone's responsible for this, it's me.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: I don't want any of you to blame yourselves.
Olivia looks into the eyes of all the troupe members who had sparring practices with her.

texts.name: Kiki
texts.text: But are we acting without you? Can we even do that?

texts.name: Thomas
texts.text: Nah, not a chance in hell.

texts.name: Kiki
texts.text: I figured.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: We don't have Spencer's support anymore, so we can't afford to cancel the performance if we want to keep the troupe alive.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: I will perform on stage today, but...

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: You all are well aware of what happens to troupes that allow women to perform, don't you?

texts.name: Kiki
texts.text: Yeah, we know.

texts.name: Thomas
texts.text: But we were all petty thieves or worse before coming here.

texts.name: Kiki
texts.text: If you're going up on stage, I am too.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: Have you given any thought as to what would happen if we're caught?

texts.name: Kiki
texts.text: Yeah.

texts.name: Thomas
texts.text: You know we used to be petty thieves, lad.

texts.name: Kiki
texts.text: Besides, remember what the leader said.

texts.name: Kiki
texts.text: I'm the main attraction.
Olivia turns a silent, tremulous gaze to Kiki.

texts.name: Kiki
texts.text: I will be with you on stage.

texts.name: Thomas
texts.text: Former thieves we may be, but now we're slaves.
Kiki doesn't go along with Thomas' joking remark. Instead, he shakes his head.

texts.name: Kiki
texts.text: No, we're actors now. And the actors of this troupe will act!

texts.name: Thomas
texts.text: Yeah, I'm with you.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: Kiki's right.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: You are not my slaves anymore.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: And, freed from any obligation...
Olivia trails off, searching for the right words.
All the members of the troupe wait patiently for her to continue.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: ...Will you stand with me on the stage?

texts.name: Kiki
texts.text: Aye, ma'am.

texts.name: Thomas
texts.text: Imagine being so popular the competition has to sabotage your performance, eh? I could boast about it for my whole life.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: That's a good way to put it.
Everyone heads into the wings and sets about preparing for the show.
Olivia watches them go.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: They're a treasure, aren't they?

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: ...Mhm.
Olivia nods.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: I wouldn't trade one of them for the world.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: Mhm.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: I'm so proud of them all.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: Let's get ready.
Today's our third performance of Hamlet.
Every single one of us chose to stand on stage alongside Olivia.
Her calm voice resonates throughout the theater.
The audience is quiet once more.
They're fully absorbed in the world we've created.
They're enraptured listening to Olivia's lines.
Until the main door of the theater bursts open, so loud that we can hear it backstage.

texts.name: Police Officer
texts.text: Nobody move!

texts.name: Will
texts.text: It's them.

texts.name: Kiki
texts.text: The watchmen! They're really here!

texts.name: Thomas
texts.text: Marlowe's reached a new low, eh?

texts.name: Kiki
texts.text: Or we've risen too high.
A group of watchmen trample their way in.

texts.name: Police Officer
texts.text: Hey, you!
One of them bellows at Olivia, who's standing in the center of the stage.

texts.name: Police Officer
texts.text: Take off the hat, and show your face.
I run out onto the stage.
If I keep her behind me, maybe we can talk our way out of this.

texts.name: Police Officer
texts.text: Hey! Don't move!
The pack of watchmen rush the stage.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: Will, it's fine.
Beneath the hat, she's smiling.
Olivia turns to face the audience.
I also look ahead.
I see Marlowe leaning against a wall by the entrance.
He waves at me with a smirk on his face.
I grit my teeth.
He'd really go this far?
He wants recognition from the stupid court that badly?
Still...
The fact is, we came here knowing the risk.
Olivia puts her hand to the hat that hides her hair and face.
Then she gracefully removes it.

texts.name: Police Officer
texts.text: You're a woman, right?

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: I think that should be plainly obvious.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: Have you ever seen a man this beautiful before?

texts.name: Police Officer
texts.text: Seize them all.
Olivia looks down at the flustered officers trying to storm their way onto the stage with a confident smile.
Then, she slowly turns to face me.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: I'm sorry for dragging you down, Will.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: But... we had good times.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: What are you—
One of the watchmen grabs her by the arm.
She makes no effort to resist.
They begin to storm the wings as well.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: Get your hands off her, you filthy cur!
Before I can even finish shouting at the man, I'm restrained by two of them.
Two watchmen just for me? Really?
It should be pretty obvious I'm not that strong.
This is definitely overkill.
The theater is in a state of pandemonium, a total reversal from the silence during Hamlet.
As they press me to the ground, I look up at Olivia.
She's gazing at the theater with melancholy eyes.
All I can do is stare at her.
I hear Kiki raise his voice in protest from the wings.
It sounds like Thomas is bashing some heads in.
I can't help but smile.
Olivia looks down at me.
She's also smiling in disbelief.
We're tied up, rounded up, and put onto carts.
I know where we're being taken.
The prison with with one entrance and no exit—the Clink.
The place where Ed was imprisoned.
The room I'm thrown into is completely bare.
It's a small, single occupancy gaol cell.
The watchman who threw me onto the floor leaves, and a while later, a familiar man comes in.
I try to remember where I've seen him before.
And in a moment, I realize.
That day...
That town's constable, who was chatting with Marlowe while Ed was apprehended.

texts.name: Chief of Police
texts.text: So you are William Shakespeare, I assume. The playwright who's the talk of the town.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: My reputation precedes me, I suppose.

texts.name: Chief of Police
texts.text: You've come far for a little bartender rat.
I look up at the man.
He looks down at me with a grin.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: You know an awful lot about me.

texts.name: Chief of Police
texts.text: I fear you underestimate us, lad. You were connected to that missionary, weren't you?

texts.name: Chief of Police
texts.text: He frequented your pub, I hear.

texts.name: Chief of Police
texts.text: But it seems like you changed occupations as of late.
The constable continues to bare his teeth in an unnaturally wolfish grin.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: What are you trying to say?

texts.name: Chief of Police
texts.text: You have fun acting, eh?

texts.name: Chief of Police
texts.text: Made your fair share of friends?
When I don't answer, the constable slowly casts his gaze over the tiny cell.

texts.name: Chief of Police
texts.text: This place stinks, doesn't it?

texts.name: Will
texts.text: Funny you mention that. I thought it was your breath stinking up the place.

texts.name: Chief of Police
texts.text: Hahahah!
After a throaty laugh, the constable grabs me by the cheeks.
He presses them into my face so hard my teeth bite into the soft flesh of my mouth.

texts.name: Chief of Police
texts.text: Better watch your mouth. You'll lose most of your sass after three days in this place anyway. I'm not here to play games with you.
While holding my face in an iron grip, he brings his own in closer.
I can see the rows of yellowed teeth grinning at me.

texts.name: Chief of Police
texts.text: I'll be merciful and give you a choice. You have the power to save your little friends.

texts.name: Chief of Police
texts.text: No one cares about arresting some woman in drag.

texts.name: Chief of Police
texts.text: I just owe Marlowe some favors, nothing personal.

texts.name: Chief of Police
texts.text: If he wants me to grab someone and throw him in the gaol, I do it. A crime's a crime.

texts.name: Chief of Police
texts.text: But what I want isn't little ham actor scoundrels like you and your lot.

texts.name: Chief of Police
texts.text: I don't give a rat's arse about these petty crimes. What I want is Catholic heads!

texts.name: Chief of Police
texts.text: I don't give a rat's arse about these petty crimes. What I want is bloody Catholic necks!

texts.name: Chief of Police
texts.text: If I can nail them, I'll ascend to the gentry too. Catholics have the only heads that really fetch a price.
He squeezes my cheeks in even harder.

texts.name: Chief of Police
texts.text: I know they all gather in your little pub. When's the next reunion, eh? Are you the organizer? Or is it one of the guests?

texts.name: Chief of Police
texts.text: You haven't been gathering as of late, have you? Now, that's no good. Get together and pray! Have yourselves a merry little meeting!

texts.name: Chief of Police
texts.text: Call all the Catholics you know to that little rat hole of yours. Do that...

texts.name: Chief of Police
texts.text: ...and I'll release all of your troupe right now. Not a bad deal, is it?
He lets go of me.
My face feels numb.

texts.name: Chief of Police
texts.text: What do say you, lad?

texts.name: Will
texts.text: I'm afraid I have no idea what you're talking about.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: And the only thing that stinks here is your damn breath. It started smelling better as soon as you got out of my face.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: This place doesn't seem too bad to me, eh?
The constable grins again.

texts.name: Chief of Police
texts.text: Hey, you see that stain on the wall? Yeah, that one. The horizontal line.

texts.name: Chief of Police
texts.text: What do you suppose that's from?
I can see a brown mark smudged across the stone at the spot he points to.

texts.name: Chief of Police
texts.text: When it rains, the Sage river goes up, you see, and it floods this room..

texts.name: Chief of Police
texts.text: Queen Elizabeth knows no mercy, eh? She probably built this place knowing that that happens.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: I agree, she probably did.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: She seems like a merciless woman indeed.

texts.name: Chief of Police
texts.text: Nothing comes free in here. Not a bed, not candles, not even food.

texts.name: Chief of Police
texts.text: The Queen doesn't spare resources for us to feed ham actors.

texts.name: Chief of Police
texts.text: You could even get out if you had enough money. Too bad you're not a noble. I sympathize there.

texts.name: Chief of Police
texts.text: Think hard and well. Your troupe's doing well, ain't it? My offer isn't bad.
With that, he gets up and leaves.
I just can't do it.
I'd rather die than sell out Dad and Rob.
I let out a huge sigh.
I sit down with my back to the wall of the narrow cell.
It's over.
It's all over.
I feel the strength leaving my limbs.
Looking back on everything, it all seems like a dream.
I acted out my own scripts together with Olivia's troupe, earning rave reviews from audiences.
I shared a love with the beautiful Olivia.
Even the pub flourished.
Everything was going so well that I let my guard down about the danger inherent in Olivia’s performance.
Seems the tab for it all has come due.
But...
A limp smile appears on my face.
The thrill I've felt these last few weeks is more than most men get in a lifetime.
One lifetime won’t be enough to pay that debt in full.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: Hahah...
Well, aren't you carefree?
I hear a voice through the wall.
I stare at the wall behind me for a while.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: Olivia?

texts.name: Will
texts.text: You were listening?

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: Don't make it sound like I was eavesdropping. I just happened to hear.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: Will?

texts.name: Will
texts.text: I'm sorry, Olivia.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: Selling out the pub, my dad...

texts.name: Will
texts.text: I just can't do it.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: I'm sorry.
And then, silence.
I try to picture what her expression must be on the other side of that wall.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: You were right, this isn't as bad as I imagined.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: I went from a disgustingly huge manor, to sleeping in a seedy pub, and now a gaol cell.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: But it's really not as bad as it seems from the outside, is it?
She speaks in her usual tone.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: If I need to start begging my own slave to save my life, I'd rather die with him. I couldn't take such humiliation.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: And if you keep treating me like a damsel in distress, I'll have you hanged.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: Hah, okay.
At some point I've begun smiling in earnest.
A peaceful silence fills the room.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: But I do have one regret.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: Mm?

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: I wasn't able to see your new work completed.
Realizing that Will is in the cell next to mine, I sit down and hug my knees.
I lean my back against the cold stone wall.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: We were so close.
Yes, we were close.
To everything.
So close to completing the story we'd begun.
With just a little more time, our story could have begun.
So close...
So close to being with the first man I've ever loved.
I can't stand it.
I let the tears roll freely down my cheeks.
They fall soundlessly onto the stone, leaving damp little circles.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: Death, that hath suck'd the honey of thy breath...
I raise my face.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: ...hath had no power yet upon thy beauty.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: Will?

texts.name: Will
texts.text: Thou art not conquer'd, beauty's ensign yet is crimson in thy lips and in thy cheeks.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: And death's pale flag is not advanced there.
I hear his voice through the stone walls.
It's high, for a man's voice, and sweet.
That voice that's had a grip on my heart since the moment I first head it.
Yes.
Even in death, Juliet is still beautiful.
Just like Olivia, even when her stage has been taken from her.
These are Romeo's feelings in the face of her death.
They flow out of me.
I'm a playwright, but I'm also an actor now.
I've found myself warming up to the role, all thanks to Olivia's encouragement.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: Romeo...

texts.name: Will
texts.text: News of Juliet's death reaches him before the news of her plan. And then...

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: ...The third tragedy.
I hear Olivia's voice through the cold stone walls.
I nod to myself.
That's right.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: Romeo acquires poison and goes to where Juliet is.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: And then...

texts.name: Will
texts.text: While basking in her beauty one last time, he drinks of the poison.
There is no other place for Romeo to breathe his last.
None but beside the woman he loved.
He must do it, before the cold hand of death can rob her of warmth...
And so, Romeo dies beside the body of his beloved.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: And Juliet...

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: When she wakes from her induced sleep, she sees Romeo's prone form next to her.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: His body is still warm, his cheeks soft beneath her hands.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: But now, the wall of death stands between them.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: Just like this cold stone wall between us.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: O churl... drunk all, and left no friendly drop to help me after?

texts.name: Will
texts.text: Juliet picks up the empty cup of poison and laments to herself.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: She has woken from her long sleep only to find that Romeo has gone to his.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: She sees no point in living on. Her world has lost all color.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: She hears footsteps coming their way.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: Only a life of pain with a man she doesn't want awaits her. A life without Romeo.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: Juliet picks up his dagger and pierces her own chest with it.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: For that is the only way to be with her beloved for eternity.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: ...And it's done.
For some reason, I'm crying.
Finally, it's done.
Olivia and I finished it together.
We created what we envisioned.
A true love story.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: Hey, Will.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: Yes?

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: It's a masterpiece.
I let out a small chuckle.
I close my eyes and nod deeply.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: Yeah, it is. A masterpiece.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: I'm sure this story will keep moving people's hearts decades—no, hundreds of years from now.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: Yeah.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: Don't you think that perhaps we met for a reason?

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: Me, to make your talent bloom.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: And you, to bring this story about us to life.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: Yeah.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: It will live on in people's hearts long after we're dead and buried.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: ...Yes.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: Make sure you write it down.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: What?

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: The unfinished script. Promise you will write it to the end.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: That's an order.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: We should both sleep now. Our priority should be saving our energy to survive this. This is your leader's order.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: But...

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: Understood?

texts.name: Will
texts.text: All right. Tomorrow, we can think how to get out of here. There must be a way.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: ...Yes.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: Good night, Will.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: Good night, Olivia.
The cell has a skylight.
I can see the moon through it.
A full moon.
I will never forget the sight of this moon.
No matter what the future holds.
Even if I were to look up at the moon from the arms of someone else.
It will always remind me of this day.
Of the way we spun a story about our love, together.
How, despite the wall between us, we saw the very same scene in our minds.
And...
How we created a masterpiece that will go down in history.
Two people who belong together.
Two people deserving of happiness.
Two people who strove to be together, but will never reach that happy end.
That's where the true essence of the play lies.
I'm glad I met Will.
I've no regrets.
I don't even regret standing on stage.
I'm an actress.
And I will be so to the very end.
But...

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: I wanted to perform it...
That story inspired by our encounter.
At least once...
As the woman he loved...
I wanted to perform it for him.
But that wish won't come true.
The times we live in won't allow for it.
But someday...
The day will come when a woman who shares my aspirations stands proudly on the stage.
I'm sure it'll happen. It has to.
Even if centuries must pass, this story will touch people's hearts.
Because what our story shows is, without a doubt, true love.
I stare at the floor.
My tears fall without a sound.
Only the moon is witness to them.
I'm sure Will hasn't noticed.
That's fine.
I will continue to act, to play a role.
But I loved you.
I loved you, and only you.
As long as I know that, nothing else matters.
I listen closely, and hear his deep, even breathing as he sleeps.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: You really are carefree...
A smile touches my lips.
It was my own selfishness that dragged the rest of the troupe down.
I will save them all.
This is my last role as their leader.
I get up and pound on the thick wooden door.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: Warden! I need to call upon someone.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: Ah!
A hard kick to the stomach wakes me up.
The blinding light around me slowly gives way to shapes.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: Huh?
Right, I fell asleep.
I didn't even mean to.
The thick wooden door in front of me...
...is open.

texts.name: Warden
texts.text: Get up, worm.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: What?!

texts.name: Kiki
texts.text: Will!

texts.name: Will
texts.text: Guys!
The warden hauls me out of the Clink. I find the rest of the troupe waiting at the entrance.

texts.name: Kiki
texts.text: You're safe!

texts.name: Thomas
texts.text: Ack, what's with these clowns? First they lock us up, and then they throw us out.

texts.name: Kiki
texts.text: Right? Isn't this too much of an overreaction? I mean, the only thing that happened is they found out our leader is a woman!

texts.name: Kiki
texts.text: So I'm okay but she's not? This country's gone to hell, I tell you.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: You're right. I wonder what's so abominable about a woman crossdressing.
Kiki nods, obviously dissatisfied.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: But we knew this would happen if word got out. Let's just count our blessings and rejoice that everyone's safe.

texts.name: Thomas
texts.text: The only one left in there is...
Thomas takes a look at the rest of the troupe.

texts.name: Kiki
texts.text: The leader, right?

texts.name: Will
texts.text: Let's wait. She should come out soon.

texts.name: Kiki
texts.text: Right.
But no matter how long we wait, Olivia never comes.

texts.name: Thomas
texts.text: Mmm...

texts.name: Kiki
texts.text: You think she may have gotten out before all of us?

texts.name: Will
texts.text: No... She wouldn't leave us behind.

texts.name: Thomas
texts.text: Then...

texts.name: Kiki
texts.text: I guess as the main culprit, they won't let her out so easy...
Just then, the warden pokes his head out of the tower door.

texts.name: Warden
texts.text: Oi, how long are you gonna stick around? You want to get thrown into a cell again?

texts.name: Will
texts.text: There's still one of us in there. A tall woman with white hair.

texts.name: Warden
texts.text: What are you going on about? She left long ago. She's the reason you're out free.

texts.name: Thomas
texts.text: Huh?

texts.name: Kiki
texts.text: What does it mean?
The warden lets out an exasperated sigh and goes back inside.

texts.name: Kiki
texts.text: What's happening? Does that mean the leader is gone already?

texts.name: Thomas
texts.text: Maybe she just left?

texts.name: Kiki
texts.text: But where could she have gone to?
...To Spencer.

texts.name: Kiki
texts.text: Will?

texts.name: Will
texts.text: She...
She did it.
She sold herself.
To Spencer.
To save us.

texts.name: Thomas
texts.text: Will?
What do I do?
What can I do?
My mind is racing.
I want to run to her side right now.
But...

texts.name: Kiki
texts.text: Will, are you okay?

texts.name: Thomas
texts.text: Lad, you look as pale as a sheet.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: No...
I can't.
What will become of the troupe if I run off on my own?
Without a patron, they're as good as vagrants.
I would be rendering Olivia's sacrifice meaningless.
I understand.
It's possible that this was the only way.
I understand it, and yet...
I clench my trembling hands into fists.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: Let's go back to the theater for now. You left your clothes backstage, right?

texts.name: Will
texts.text: Let's go back, and then...

texts.name: Will
texts.text: We'll talk about what to do next.

texts.name: Kiki
texts.text: Yeah, let's do that for now.

texts.name: Thomas
texts.text: Yeah, at least we know the leader is safe now. That's good.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: There's something I need to do. Kiki, go to the theater with the others. Everyone's still upset from all this. Choose someone to coordinate things in the meantime.

texts.name: Kiki
texts.text: Huh?

texts.name: Thomas
texts.text: Where are you going?

texts.name: Will
texts.text: I'll be back soon. I'll meet you at the theater, I promise.

texts.name: Kiki
texts.text: O-Okay.

texts.name: Thomas
texts.text: See you, lad!
I leave them and run as fast as my legs can carry me.
Why, Olivia?
No, I know the answer very well.
She fulfilled her duty as the leader of the troupe.
She didn't want us all to suffer because of her.
That's why she offered herself to Spencer again.
I understand the reasoning.
She has no other choice.
She was thinking of Kiki, Thomas, and the rest of the troupe members.
She didn't want to force them into taking the fall.
But Olivia, why didn't you tell me?
Why did you shoulder all of this on your own?
Doesn't my presence matter at all?
How long must I...
How long must we...
How long must we be at the mercy of fate?
I just want to be with the person I love.
Are we not permitted even this small measure of happiness?
All she did was stand on stage!
What's wrong with that?
How many hearts did her voice touch from the stage of the Globe?
She resisted the status quo, held firm to her beliefs, and moved the hearts of countless people.
And this is the price she has to pay?
My breath turns ragged, and my throat feels dry.
Still, I run.
I am sick and fed up.
I don't want to lose someone who matters to me. Not again.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: Open this door! I'm William Shakespeare!

texts.name: Will
texts.text: Open this bloody door!
I bang my fist against the heavy manor door.
A low sound echoes out with each knock.
Just as my hand starts to numb from the exertion, the door slowly opens.
This time, Spencer is the one who greets me.
He stares at me, clearly not amused by my presence.

texts.name: Spencer
texts.text: Hola. How can I help you, chico?

texts.name: Will
texts.text: Is Olivia here?

texts.name: Spencer
texts.text: She is, por supuesto.

texts.name: Spencer
texts.text: This is her hogar, her home.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: Let me see her.

texts.name: Spencer
texts.text: I'm afraid not. That wouldn't be very hermoso of me, William Shakespeare.

texts.name: Spencer
texts.text: You should know that better than anyone.

texts.name: Spencer
texts.text: Your paths are separados. They will never cross again.

texts.name: Spencer
texts.text: That is a beautiful tragedia, indeed.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: Our lives aren't a play. We have the right to fight against whatever fate throws at us!

texts.name: Spencer
texts.text: The right you may have, but the poder is what you lack. That's just how it is.

texts.name: Spencer
texts.text: You don't seem to understand how precarious your standing is ahora mismo.

texts.name: Spencer
texts.text: Do you remember the deal we made not so long ago?

texts.name: Spencer
texts.text: The guarantee in case your plan didn't go well was you, remember? That was our deal, yes?

texts.name: Spencer
texts.text: But you seem to be pretty much libre, free at the moment. I'm sure you know why that is.
Spencer's eyes on me are cold.
I usually find the man fairly unreadable, but today, the contempt he holds me in is plain to be seen.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: Olivia?

texts.name: Spencer
texts.text: Exacto. I knew you'd understand.

texts.name: Spencer
texts.text: In the end, little Olive was the one to protect you. And yet you come to incordiarme so rudely.

texts.name: Spencer
texts.text: Leave this place right now, William Shakespeare. Anyone but you would have gotten his cabeza removed from his neck.

texts.name: Spencer
texts.text: You write such beautiful historias. Your life could be so hermoso.

texts.name: Spencer
texts.text: But you are being incredibly unsightly right now. Not hermoso at all.

texts.name: Spencer
texts.text: Olive is my prometida now. We shall leave this country in the autumn.

texts.name: Spencer
texts.text: You and Olive will keep those summer memorias close to your hearts as you both crumble to dust from grief.

texts.name: Spencer
texts.text: Isn't that a tragedia for the ages?

texts.name: Spencer
texts.text: It is as hermoso as the historias you write. So, write! A stage befitting your great talent has been arranged for you.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: What?
Spencer raises his hand, and the butler from before arrives and presents a brown sealed envelope.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: What is this?

texts.name: Spencer
texts.text: Something that you won with your own quill. It's for you to have.
I turn the envelope over.
It bears the seal of the royal family.
I break the red wax and open the letter.
Inside is an official notice.
I'm at a loss for words.
This, of all things? Now?
How can this be?
Truly, Queen Elizabeth knows no mercy.

texts.name: Spencer
texts.text: You might throw yourself into your work to continue to chase dreams of Olive, or to forget her entirely if you so choose.

texts.name: Spencer
texts.text: Your path lies ahead; all you must do is follow it. The Reina says so as well.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: ...I'll have you know one thing.

texts.name: Spencer
texts.text: Que?

texts.name: Will
texts.text: Olivia and I aren't characters in a bloody play. To hell with your so-called beauty.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: To see her again...

texts.name: Will
texts.text: I would crawl through the mud on my hands and knees.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: I would lick grime off the shoes of the person I hate the most.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: Tell Olivia that's what I said.

texts.name: Spencer
texts.text: I didn't want to hear such a hackneyed poema come out of your mouth.
I turn my back on Spencer.
Burning anger and crippling sadness. Crushing loss and roaring belligerence.
A mix of all these feelings churns in my chest.
I clench my fists so hard that my nails dig into my palms.
Everyone's waiting for me.
All the people Olivia protected are there in the theater.
I'm still not alone.
I grind my teeth and head to the theater.
When I get there, everyone's gathered by the empty stage.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: Everyone.
The eyes of the whole troupe are on me.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: Olivia...

texts.name: Will
texts.text: She paid for our freedom.

texts.name: Kiki
texts.text: Yeah, we thought so. We'll have to fill the seats again tomorrow, huh?
I slowly shake my head.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: She didn't spend the troupe's money.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: She sold herself. To Spencer.

texts.name: Kiki
texts.text: Huh?

texts.name: Thomas
texts.text: What do you mean?

texts.name: Will
texts.text: She got engaged to him, like he always wanted.

texts.name: Kiki
texts.text: Why?!

texts.name: Will
texts.text: To save us.

texts.name: Kiki
texts.text: It can't be! But we have the revenue!

texts.name: Will
texts.text: She wanted us to have the money.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: You really think we'll be able to pull in the same revenue now that she's gone?
Everyone stares at me in silence, their expressions grim.
"I look after my esclavos, that's my personal policy."
That's what Spencer said.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: What she did was almost certainly the only way to get us all out.
Knowing full well that she may never stand on the stage again, she locked herself in that desolate manor.
And yet I took an oath that that she'd never have to go back to Spencer on my watch...

texts.name: Will
texts.text: I want to take Olivia back.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: But right now, I don't have that power.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: That's why... I need your help.

texts.name: Kiki
texts.text: You know we'll always have your back.

texts.name: Thomas
texts.text: But can we actually do, Boss?
I hold up the envelope Spencer gave me.

texts.name: Kiki
texts.text: What's that?

texts.name: Thomas
texts.text: A letter?

texts.name: Will
texts.text: We...

texts.name: Will
texts.text: ...have been granted a court performance.

texts.name: Kiki&Thomas
texts.text: What?!

texts.name: Kiki
texts.text: But the leader isn't here!

texts.name: Will
texts.text: Still...

texts.name: Will
texts.text: All subjects of the realm must do as Queen Elizabeth commands.

texts.name: Kiki
texts.text: Yeah, but...

texts.name: Will
texts.text: That holds true...

texts.name: Will
texts.text: ...for everyone, no matter their station.

texts.name: Kiki
texts.text: Huh?

texts.name: Will
texts.text: Let's do it.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: It's not like we can put on public performances right now, so we have lots of time to prepare.

texts.name: Thomas
texts.text: When are we being summoned?

texts.name: Will
texts.text: Seven days. We have one week.

texts.name: Kiki
texts.text: That's not exactly lots of time!

texts.name: Thomas
texts.text: That's even tighter than when we had to do Hamlet!

texts.name: Will
texts.text: Our performance was interrupted. And this is our last...
Yes, this is the last.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: This is our last chance to perform on stage with our leader. Don't you want to act this to the final curtain?

texts.name: Will
texts.text: Aren't you pissed at all the prating knaves who tried to stop us?

texts.name: Kiki
texts.text: Yeah, I feel the same.

texts.name: Thomas
texts.text: So we're doing Hamlet?

texts.name: Will
texts.text: No, my new play.

texts.name: Kiki&Thomas
texts.text: The new one?!

texts.name: Will
texts.text: I completed it with Olivia last night. I'm sure it will suit Queen Elizabeth's palate.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: I'll prepare everyone's scripts now. Have your lines and blocking memorized within the week.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: I remember just how Olivia used to yell at us, and I plan to reproduce it to the letter.

texts.name: Kiki
texts.text: Whoa...

texts.name: Thomas
texts.text: So we're getting yelled at even when she's not here?

texts.name: Kiki
texts.text: That new work is, you know... The story about you two?
I nod.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: The play's title is...

texts.name: Will
texts.text: ...Romeo and Juliet.
We have one week.
We stop our performances at the Globe and devote ourselves to rehearsals.
I am Romeo.
And Juliet will be...
...Olivia, of course.
But she's not here.
The only one who can summon her is Queen Elizabeth.
It was the Queen herself who requested our performance.
That's what we counted on.
We aroused the interest of the whole city so that our name would reach the ears of anyone who appreciates theater.
But the only chance we have to talk to the Queen is right before the performance.
Nobles gather in the court.
I don't think any of them have an inkling that we're here without our leading lady.
I'm risking it all on this gamble.
We kneel in front of the throne and wait for our audience.
And then...
A soft, sweet scent tickles my nose.
It's the scent of roses.
I sense people moving about in front of us, but I'm unable to see with my head bowed like this.
After a while, things settle down.

texts.name: Queen Elizabeth
texts.text: So, you are the troupe that acts in the Globe, correct?

texts.name: Will
texts.text: Yes.

texts.name: Queen Elizabeth
texts.text: Where is the one they call William Shakespeare?

texts.name: Will
texts.text: That would be me.

texts.name: Queen Elizabeth
texts.text: Rise.
I raise my face.
A woman clad in a bright red dress looks down at us, an elegant smile gracing her face.
This is...
Queen Elizabeth.

texts.name: Queen Elizabeth
texts.text: Your fame precedes you.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: ...I'm honored, Your Majesty.

texts.name: Queen Elizabeth
texts.text: You will present a comedy today? Or perhaps a tragedy?

texts.name: Will
texts.text: I bring you a tragedy, Ma'am.

texts.name: Queen Elizabeth
texts.text: Ah yes, the story about the Danish royal family.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: No.
The Queen frowns slightly.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: I bring for you today a new play.

texts.name: Queen Elizabeth
texts.text: Oh, is that so?
The corners of her mouth rise in a smile once more.

texts.name: Queen Elizabeth
texts.text: You have my attention. Begin at once.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: I cannot, Ma'am.

texts.name: Queen Elizabeth
texts.text: What?
The air feels tense.
I hear a sound.
The sound of a collective gasp from everyone around me.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: We are missing an actor.
The expression seems to drain from the Queen's face.

texts.name: Queen Elizabeth
texts.text: What is the meaning of this?

texts.name: Will
texts.text: Our leader, Olivia Berry, is being held captive, forced into an unwanted engagement.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: In exchange for our freedom.

texts.name: Queen Elizabeth
texts.text: Olivia Berry? Is your leader a woman?

texts.name: Will
texts.text: Exactly so, Ma'am.
Queen Elizabeth stares right at me.
It seems like news of what happened a week ago hasn't reached her ears.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: It became publicly known that our leader was a woman, and we were arrested during a performance.

texts.name: Queen Elizabeth
texts.text: Quite the misfortune.
The Queen's tone is flat.

texts.name: Queen Elizabeth
texts.text: Why did you place a woman on the stage?

texts.name: Queen Elizabeth
texts.text: Answer poorly, and I'll see you go back to the gaol.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: You will understand when you see Olivia Berry perform, Ma'am.
She narrows her eyes and stares down at me.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: She was born to stand on the stage.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: Not even the law can tear her from it. The heart of Olivia Berry will always be on the stage.

texts.name: Queen Elizabeth
texts.text: You mean to say there are places in this land that are beyond my authority?

texts.name: Will
texts.text: There are.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: Not even a Queen...

texts.name: Will
texts.text: ...can command that which lies inside a person's heart.
The Queen's eyes flash.
I can feel my hair standing on end.
It takes all of my willpower to not break into a trembling mess under the Queen's gaze.

texts.name: Queen Elizabeth
texts.text: Mind your tongue, William Shakespeare. This is not a stage.

texts.name: Queen Elizabeth
texts.text: Speak out of line, and I'll have your head on a silver platter.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: If my head is what you want, go ahead and take it. I already live on borrowed time.
Queen Elizabeth keeps her silent gaze fixed upon me.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: Without Olivia Berry, we cannot show you a true love story.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: I defer to your judgment, Ma'am.

texts.name: Queen Elizabeth
texts.text: Whatever do you mean?

texts.name: Will
texts.text: Abolish the gender restrictions on performers.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: And release Olivia Berry from her unwanted engagement forced upon her by this unjust law.
The throne room is so quiet you could hear a pin drop.
The tension is so thick that you could cut it with a knife.
The queen continues to fix me with her scrutinizing gaze.

texts.name: Queen Elizabeth
texts.text: You came here to say this to me?

texts.name: Will
texts.text: I came here to present you with a true love story. This is merely what I need to see it through.
Silence falls again.
The Queen blinks at me several times, and I notice one of her attendants glance at her from the side.

texts.name: Queen Elizabeth
texts.text: What you ask for...

texts.name: Queen Elizabeth
texts.text: ...will not be conceded. Your insolence is too great. Know your place, bard.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: Ma'am...
My head droops.
The glossy floor of the throne room is the last thing I see before I clench my eyes tight.
So it all came to nothing.
I suppose reality doesn't work like a play.

texts.name: Queen Elizabeth
texts.text: Leave.
I raise my head again.
It takes me a moment to realize that she isn't talking to me.
The gathered nobles leave.
The other troupe members are led to a separate room.
It's only me, Queen Elizabeth, and her two closest attendants left.
I can't look her in the eye.

texts.name: Queen Elizabeth
texts.text: You...

texts.name: Queen Elizabeth
texts.text: You overestimate me, boy. I don't have that kind of power.
A gentle, soft smile graces the Queen's lips.
She's not intimidating anymore; rather, she looks a little sad as she speaks.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: What?

texts.name: Queen Elizabeth
texts.text: It is not the law that impedes women from standing on stage, it's religion.

texts.name: Queen Elizabeth
texts.text: As for the engagement, the same applies. Bigamy isn't allowed. What God has put together, no man or monarch shall put asunder.

texts.name: Queen Elizabeth
texts.text: The Queen is not God.
I simply stare up at her. I'm stunned.
I open my mouth in a feeble attempt to say something, but the words don't come out.

texts.name: Queen Elizabeth
texts.text: Is it good?

texts.name: Will
texts.text: Huh?
The Queen cracks a small chuckle.

texts.name: Queen Elizabeth
texts.text: This new play of yours.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: Ah.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: ...I dare say it's a story that will be told as long as there are humans to hear it.

texts.name: Queen Elizabeth
texts.text: That is quite a claim. So I take it this is something a lover of theater simply must experience?
I answer her with a nod.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: If you don't, I am certain that you shall look back on this day and wonder what could have been.

texts.name: Queen Elizabeth
texts.text: I would regret it all the way to my grave?

texts.name: Will
texts.text: Yes.

texts.name: Queen Elizabeth
texts.text: Hahahahahah!
The Queen throws her head back and lets out a throaty laugh.
Her expressions are so human.
The expressions of a feeling human being, just like the rest of us.

texts.name: Queen Elizabeth
texts.text: Where is this Olivia Berry you speak of?

texts.name: Will
texts.text: At Harold Spencer's estate, Ma'am.

texts.name: Queen Elizabeth
texts.text: Spencer? Ah, that debauched landowner.
The exasperation in her voice is audible.

texts.name: Queen Elizabeth
texts.text: I see. So this Olivia is the woman he chose to wed and take to the New World, is she?

texts.name: Queen Elizabeth
texts.text: Summon Olivia Berry.
Queen Elizabeth commands one her attendants.
She bows her head and leaves the room at once.
The Queen turns back to me, quirking a roguish smile.

texts.name: Queen Elizabeth
texts.text: I do not have the faintest idea of what you hope to accomplish by calling this female leader of yours here.

texts.name: Queen Elizabeth
texts.text: Only men may stand on the stage. Do you understand?

texts.name: Will
texts.text: ...Yes.

texts.name: Queen Elizabeth
texts.text: However...

texts.name: Queen Elizabeth
texts.text: It has been far too long since I last saw a play. I may be too engrossed to notice the gender of the actors.

texts.name: Queen Elizabeth
texts.text: Besides...

texts.name: Queen Elizabeth
texts.text: If the audience finds themselves bored enough to care about such trifling details, you shall be decapitated for your boasts.

texts.name: Queen Elizabeth
texts.text: You promised me a story of true love, did you not?

texts.name: Will
texts.text: Yes!

texts.name: Queen Elizabeth
texts.text: Then begin your preparations at once.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: Yes!
After that, I'm taken to the waiting room with the rest of the troupe.

texts.name: Kiki
texts.text: Will!

texts.name: Thomas
texts.text: Your head's still attached?

texts.name: Will
texts.text: Yes, I'm fine.

texts.name: Kiki
texts.text: What happened?!

texts.name: Will
texts.text: We're performing.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: Olivia's on the way.
Their eyes go wide.

texts.name: Kiki
texts.text: How did you convince her?!

texts.name: Will
texts.text: I'm not sure myself, to be honest.
Kiki and Thomas cock their heads in confusion.

texts.name: Kiki
texts.text: So, it's good that the leader is coming, but are you sure this is okay?

texts.name: Thomas
texts.text: And she's playing Juliet, right? She's not even dressing as a man?

texts.name: Will
texts.text: I won't know until we get out there, but I think it'll be all right.

texts.name: Kiki
texts.text: How?!

texts.name: Will
texts.text: The Queen, she...
I remember Queen Elizabeth's smile.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: If the circumstances were different, I believe that woman might have just been a normal theater-loving girl.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: That's how.

texts.name: Kiki
texts.text: The Queen? A normal girl?

texts.name: Thomas
texts.text: Are you pulling our leg?

texts.name: Will
texts.text: It's just an impression I got.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: We'll start as soon as Olivia arrives. Get ready.
After a while, we hear footsteps approaching.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: What's this all about?! At least tell me why I'm here! I was released through lawful procedures! Do your own damn diligence!

texts.name: Kiki
texts.text: She sounds okay, at least.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: Heh, yeah.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: Huh?
Olivia freezes on the spot.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: We've been waiting for you.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: What is the meaning of this?

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: What's with the getup?

texts.name: Will
texts.text: Can't you tell?

texts.name: Will
texts.text: We're about to perform.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: In this very court, actually.
Olivia's eyes widen.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: You were chosen?

texts.name: Will
texts.text: Yes. The royal invitation arrived.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: I see. Congratulations.
Olivia's tone sounds a little sad.

texts.name: Thomas
texts.text: Congratulations? What do you think you're here for?

texts.name: Kiki
texts.text: Get changed already! All of our heads will roll if we keep the Queen waiting!

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: Huh? What do you mean, I'm...

texts.name: Will
texts.text: You wanted to perform here, didn't you?
Olivia looks up at me.
She blinks at me several times, still struggling to understand.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: The most beautiful, brightest stage in the whole world.
A light of understanding enters her eyes.
But then...
She slowly casts her gaze down.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: But I...

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: I'm a woman.
Her tone is dejected and resigned.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: Yes, but you forget one important thing.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: In this troupe, we have no rule that says women can't perform, do we?

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: Haven't you had enough with one trip to the Clink?

texts.name: Will
texts.text: We have, and that's why...

texts.name: Will
texts.text: This is our final performance. We can't change the laws of this country.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: I can't, and neither can Queen Elizabeth.
Olivia takes a deep breath.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: You spoke to the Queen?

texts.name: Will
texts.text: This is our last play, Olivia. And for your farewell performance...

texts.name: Will
texts.text: Is there a better place than the royal court?

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: What in the world? Have you all...
Olivia looks over the troupe members around us.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: ...lost your bloody minds?

texts.name: Will
texts.text: Who cares? If we go out here, at least we'll have no regrets.
Olivia still seems hesitant about it.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: You're playing Juliet today. Got your lines memorized?

texts.name: Kiki
texts.text: Here you go!
Kiki shoves the costume onto her.

texts.name: Kiki
texts.text: A beautiful costume to outshine the castle!

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: Kiki...

texts.name: Will
texts.text: We practiced our heads off. You can have the leading role... if you don't think you'll drag us down.
Tears spill out of her eyes and fall onto the costume.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: ...You'll pay for that one, fool.
And then she smiles.
She takes a few deep breaths and looks up.
There's no more hesitation in her eyes.
In its place is the confident gaze of a troupe leader set to perform on the greatest stage of all.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: Understood?
A familiar, fiery grin touches her lips.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: Let's show them what real acting looks like.

texts.name: Kiki
texts.text: Two households, both alike in dignity,

texts.name: Kiki
texts.text: In fair Verona, where we lay our scene,

texts.name: Kiki
texts.text: From ancient grudge break to new mutiny, where civil blood makes civil hands unclean.

texts.name: Kiki
texts.text: From forth the fatal loins of these two foes

texts.name: Kiki
texts.text: A pair of star-cross'd lovers take their life;

texts.name: Kiki
texts.text: Whose misadventured piteous overthrows

texts.name: Kiki
texts.text: Do with their death bury their parents' strife.

texts.name: Kiki
texts.text: The fearful passage of their death-mark'd love,

texts.name: Kiki
texts.text: And the continuance of their parents' rage, Which, but their children's end, nought could remove,

texts.name: Kiki
texts.text: Is now the two hours' traffic of our stage.

texts.name: Kiki
texts.text: Through this tale of true love that surmounts unending tragedy...

texts.name: Kiki
texts.text: ...these humble players, led by Olivia Berry, shall endeavor to serve as your guides.
The first time I saw her, I wondered how such a beautiful woman could exist.
Her voice, movements, scent...
It all gripped me and never let go.
Looking back on it, that is when my fate was decided.
From that point on, there was no way back for me.
Her charm captivated me, body and soul.
When I met her, the purpose of my writing changed.
She immersed herself in my stories.
Those moments we shared were ones of pure bliss.
My quill exalted her.
The reason for my writing...
Has been to see that joyous smile.
The first day I kissed you...
The first time I felt your warmth inside me...
Our flesh became one, our warmth became one, with no boundaries between them.
Welcome you into me was the greatest happiness of my life.
Your short breaths, hot gaze, and sweet moans...
It is all carved into me now, deep and enduring.
Never did I imagine I could love so intensely.
Enough to wish that time would stop...
So that I could be with you eternally.
Cliche though those words may be, my heart yearned for such a thing.
The time to say goodbye approaches.
It's almost upon us.
But I...
But we have no regrets.
No one can strip away the love we shared.
Those days I spent with Will will always be with me.
I can revisit them as often as I want.
They'll remain in my heart until I draw my last breath.
No matter what lies ahead, or how my life ends...
I will never resent the time we spent together.
Because we were, and we loved with all of our hearts.
We carved the proof of it into the world.
Here, through the story of Romeo and Juliet.
It will become eternal.
An eternal testament to our meeting.

texts.name: Queen Elizabeth
texts.text: A true love story, eh?

texts.name: Queen Elizabeth
texts.text: Masterfully done.

texts.name: Queen Elizabeth
texts.text: I shall remember your names. Olivia Berry, and...

texts.name: Queen Elizabeth
texts.text: ...William Shakespeare.
We go back to my room in silence, no need for words.
As soon as we step over the threshold, we share a long, fervent kiss.
Slowly, but steadily...
Our bodies come together in a flurry of passion.
Her taste spreads in my mouth.
Her scent penetrates my nose.
Her heat reaches my very heart.
With the sole aim of each to burn ourselves into the other...
We come together like never before.
Our clothes are scattered across the floor.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: Please, Will. Carve yourself into me, as deep as you can.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: Yeah...
Her breath is ragged and hot.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: Mark me, like no one else ever will...
Olivia wraps her arms around my neck and pulls me in for another kiss.
After she finally frees me, she sits back to look at me, her eyes full of tears and a smile on her face.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: Remember it all. My body, voice, taste, scent, all of it. Don't ever forget.
Olivia gently pushes me down and straddles me.
The moon is shining bright in the sky.
Its silent light watches over us as we make passionate love one last time.
I give her everything I have.
I taste every single part of her.
I commit her entire being to memory.
And then, it seems, I've fallen asleep...
Because I dream about her.
In my dreams, we act out a story we wrote.
It's a good dream.
But the dream fades, as they do, and my hazy consciousness returns.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: Mm...

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: You fell asleep?

texts.name: Will
texts.text: I think so, sorry.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: Not to worry. I fell asleep too.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: We fell asleep still connected. This is a first for me.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: Well, we did wear ourselves out today.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: Whatever do you mean?
Olivia gives me an impish smile.
