I realize the double entendre of what I said and smile back at her.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: I had a dream.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: Yes.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: I was acting with you.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: Acting out a story we wrote?
I just gaze at her.
She smiles, nuzzling her cheek against the pillow.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: I had the same dream.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: How strange. After writing together for so long, perhaps even our dreams are now connected.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: Perhaps.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: Hey, Will.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: Yes?

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: If we can share the same dreams, it wouldn't matter how apart we are.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: I think our hearts are connected forever, and not just in a poetic sense. Don't you think so?

texts.name: Will
texts.text: Yes, I think the same.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: I love you, Will. I'll always be yours, and yours alone.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: Me too.
I stroke her hair and look at the moon outside the window. When that sinks below the horizon...
It'll be time to say goodbye.
My vision blurs with tears.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: Let's sleep, Will.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: I can't bear to just wait for the moment I have to leave you. We could share another dream together, right?
Olivia smiles at me.
Her smile is so peaceful.
She's made of sterner stuff than me, to the very end.
Despite the tears running down my face, I manage to smile back at her.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: Come here.
Olivia wraps her arms around my neck.
This time, she strokes my hair gently.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: Now, we'll stay like this until you start dreaming again.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: ...Mhm.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: I'm going to sleep, so you'd better do the same, understood?

texts.name: Will
texts.text: Olivia.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: Mm?

texts.name: Will
texts.text: I love you. I will never love anyone the way I love you.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: So...

texts.name: Will
texts.text: Please...
...Don't go.
I manage not to say the words aloud.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: I know, Will. I know, and it's fine. I feel the same way.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: I love you too.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: Olivia...
There's no more to be said.
We each know what lies in the other's mind.
And yet, this is the only path we can take.
We did all we could.
But we were unable to change the world.
To change anything, really..
I cling to her in the vain hope that I never have to let go.
Our bare skin meets in a tight embrace.
I can feel her with my whole body.
I embrace her tightly, so as to mark this memory in my mind forever while I weep into her chest.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: Once the morrow comes, you'll feel better. Everything will be fine.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: We'll wake up together, and our hearts will feel renewed. We'll be able to smile again.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: Yes.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: The whole world will be awaiting your words from now on.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: Keep writing. Never stop.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: Okay? Understood?
I nod between pitiful sobs.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: Yes, I'll write... I'll write...

texts.name: Will
texts.text: I swore to you that I would.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: For you, for you only.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: I will keep writing.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: That's my boy.
She kisses my forehead.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: Go to sleep. You can rest now, okay? Once the morrow comes, you'll feel better.
Olivia strokes my head and reassures me like a mother singing her child a lullaby.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: Your sorrow will melt all away as the sun streams through the window. You'll go down to the pub and peel those potatoes until night comes again.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: Rob will come, and he'll tell you to pour your dad a drink, and then you'll pour him a cup of tasteless water.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: Yes, yes...
I'm completely enveloped by her warmth.
Her gentle, soothing voice fills me.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: You're a little incompetent, so all you can make is bland mashed potatoes, but Rob will clean his plate while complaining all the way.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: Kiki, Thomas, and all the other troupe members will come. The seats at your counter will be full of actors to fill your life with color.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: Yes...
My consciousness dims as I sink into her warmth.
Is this a dream?
Surely there is no place but dreams where one can feel so at peace.
That's right.
Maybe I'm dreaming already.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: And then, standing behind that bustling bar, you will feel the seeds of new stories sprout inside of you.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: Yes...

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: You will nurture them until they bloom. Your eyes will shine with new ideas. And neither storm nor gale will stop you from writing.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: As long as you do that...

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: ...your stories will always reach me.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: No matter where I am in the world, they will reach me.
All right.
I'll keep writing stories for Olivia.
Neither storm nor gale will stop me.
And then...
I fall into a deep, pleasant slumber.
In the end...
I lied to Will.
This sadness is here to stay.
Even the sun can't burn away this love.
For as long as I live...
I will never leave behind this sadness.
I believe Will knows this too.
I sit up and watch him sleep peacefully.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: What a carefree man.
I watch him, so defenseless and open.
So innocent.
He doesn't look like a man who had the courage to try his luck against a Queen.
In his sleep, he looks like just a boy.
The love welling in me comes out as tears that spill from my eyes.
But I care not.
Like these tears, my love will never run dry.
No matter how many I shed, they'll never stop.
They trail down my cheeks and wet my lips.
Leaning in, I place small, salty kisses on his eyelids.
Through the window, I can see the moon.
How many times have I looked up at this moon since Will and I first met?
Dawn will soon come.
And so will the time for us to part.
I can't bear to see you cry anymore.
I want to stay a strong woman in your heart.
That's why...
I will sear the image of your innocent, sleeping face into my mind.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: Farewell, William Shakespeare.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: The only man I ever loved.
I plant one last, silent kiss on his lips.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: Farewell, my love...
